questionText.text: Which law states that the pressure of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume at constant temperature?

quiz.instructionText: Select the correct answer and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Boyle's Law describes the pressure-volume relationship.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: The correct answer is Boyle's Law.

questionText.text: Which of the following are types of gears?

quiz.instructionText: Select all correct answers and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Spur, Bevel, and Helical gears are all types of gears.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Ball Bearing is not a gear; it's a rolling element.

questionText.text: Thermodynamics deals with heat and temperature and their relation to energy and work.

quiz.instructionText: Select True or False and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Thermodynamics studies heat, temperature, and energy.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Thermodynamics is the science of heat and energy transfer.

questionText.text: Which instrument is used to measure pressure?

quiz.instructionText: Select the correct answer and select Submit.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: The correct answer is Manometer.

questionText.text: Which of the following are prime movers?

quiz.instructionText: Select all correct answers and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Steam Turbine, Hydraulic Turbine, and Diesel Engine are all prime movers.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Gear Pump is not a prime mover.

questionText.text: The SI unit of force is the Newton.

quiz.instructionText: Select True or False and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Newton is the SI unit of force.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Newton (N) is the standard unit of force.

questionText.text: Which one of the following is used to reduce friction between moving parts?

quiz.instructionText: Select the correct answer and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Lubricants reduce friction between parts.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Lubricant is the correct answer.

questionText.text: Which materials are commonly used in manufacturing gears?

quiz.instructionText: Select all correct answers and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Cast Iron, Steel, and Bronze are commonly used materials for gears.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Glass is not used in gear manufacturing.

questionText.text: Welding is a process used to join two or more materials together.

quiz.instructionText: Select True or False and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Welding joins materials using heat or pressure.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: Welding is a joining process.

questionText.text: Which process is used to remove unwanted material from a workpiece?

quiz.instructionText: Select the correct answer and select Submit.

correctFbText.text: Correct: Machining removes material to shape the part.

wrongFbText.text: Incorrect: The correct answer is Machining.
